question_text: Which of the following reflect advanced use cases for virtual machines? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Creating isolated environments for malware testing
Supporting legacy applications with outdated OS dependencies
Running redundant power supplies to virtual hosts
Providing multiple OS environments for software testing teams
correct_answer: Creating isolated environments for malware testing
Supporting legacy applications with outdated OS dependencies
Providing multiple OS environments for software testing teams
explanation: These reflect high-level use cases involving development, compatibility, and isolation. Power redundancy is hardware-level, not VM-specific.
